availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alfred Franklin Gowdy (Taylor County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah L. Gowdy. Father of Alise M. Gowdy, Alfred B. Gowdy, David W. Gowdy, John Edwin Gowdy, Emma J. Gowdy, James T. Gowdy, and George H. Gowdy. Owned nine enslaved persons in Taylor County in 1850. Merchant in Taylor County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 112.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 112.
Find A Grave, "Alfred Franklin Gowdy (1815-1876)," Memorial #63720417, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63720417 (accessed September 25, 2019).
